Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is growing well with plenty of water and light.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well because it lacks water.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well because it lacks light.
The student can show the difference between plants that have and do not have what they need to grow (water and light).
The student can use their drawings to explain why plants need water and light to live and grow.
